newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia, Britain sign social security contract.
newsitem.headline: Croatia, Britain sign social security contract.

text.p: Croatian and British government delegations signed on Friday a preliminary bilateral agreement simplifying the payment of pensions earned in the other country, state news agency HINA reported.

The accord, which has yet to be endorsed by the two governments, says pensions will from now on be estimated in line with local laws, taking into account only how long a person worked in the other country.
The accord will be applied in both countries, HINA said.

"Convenient novelty ... is that Croatian citizens will now be able to recieve British pensions when they return to Croatia, which until now was impossible," said a statement by the Croatian Pensions Fund. -- Metka Jelenc, Zagreb Newsroom, 385 1 4557075
